447735.title: Senior Lawyer - Migration
447735.description:
• Be a part of a feminist community organisation supporting Victorian women.
  • A fantastic opportunity to build the role and make it your own!
  • Full time or part time (min 4 days) – Ongoing
  • Your expertise will directly contribute to building a more gender-equitable society
  • Located in Melbourne's legal precinct, with public transport on your doorstep.
  • Hybrid working model (part in office/working from home), promoting a true work/life balance.
  • A welcoming, passionate, and supportive work culture
  • Competitive remuneration, bonus leave days, flexible work arrangements, salary packaging

About Women’s Legal Service Victoria

Women’s Legal Service Victoria (Women’s Legal) works with women experiencing family violence to find safety and get legal advice. Our legal team, social workers and financial counsellors work with thousands of women each year to ensure that they have what they need to make decisions for themselves and their family. The service we provide is trauma-informed and covers family law, family violence, victims of crime, migration and child protection.

We provide practical legal advice to workers supporting victim-survivors of family violence and train thousands of lawyers and community workers each year to recognise family violence and legal issues that comes with it. Our experience guides our policy and advocacy work to improve the law for women and their children.

Everyone who works with us directly contributes to building a more gender-equitable society.

Your new role

The Senior Lawyer, Migration will provide high quality legal advice and assistance to women on temporary visas who are experiencing family violence. The Senior Lawyer will conduct complex migration matters for women experiencing family violence and disadvantage.

  • Maintain a high and complex caseload of migration and family violence matters. You may also maintain by a caseload spanning other areas of law such as family law, family violence, child protection, crime and/or victims of crime assistance;
  • Provide high level legal advice and representation through service delivery programs, including duty lawyer services and our health justice partnership at Monash Health;
  • Build and develop the capacity of Women’s Legal to work with and assist women on temporary visas with concurrent family law or child protection law needs;
  • Mentor and support other lawyers to develop their legal and practice management skills;
  • Occasionally support and/or mentor lawyers from other Community Legal Centre's.

This is a full time or part time (minimum 4 days) position.

What you’ll need to succeed

To succeed in this role, you should have advanced skills to manage a complex caseload. Your ability to provide high level legal advice and representation while being able to approach your work through a trauma informed lens. You must hold an unrestricted practicing certificate and have at least 4 years post admission experience.

  • Experience with working with women experiencing family violence;
  • Experience in advocacy with the Department of Home Affairs and at the Administrative Appeals Tribunal; and
  • Experience in litigation and court advocacy in the Federal Court, Family Court/Federal Circuit Court, Magistrates Court and/or Children’s Court desirable.

What you’ll get in return

In return for your dedication, we offer competitive remuneration, bonus leave days, flexible work arrangements, salary packaging, and a vibrant, supportive work culture.

The detail:

  • Up to 8 bonus leave days outside of annual leave (yes, outside of annual leave!) to support a well-rested end of year break
  • Above-award remuneration
  • A strong commitment to your professional development, personal development, and wellbeing
  • A very flexible working environment that supports work-life balance
  • A hybrid working model that supports both in-office and work-from-home arrangements
  • Salary packaging (which can add up to $15,900 in tax-free pay every year)
  • Fresh fruit available in the office
  • Access to our Employee Assistance Program

To Apply

Submit a resume and covering letter to tell us how you are the right candidate for this role and address how you personally align to Women’s Legal values that are listed above.

See the Women’s Legal ‘Work with Us’ page for a full position description.

Any other enquiries can be emailed to Ruth McKendrick, HR Officer at hr@womenslegal.org.au, using the subject line: Senior Lawyer - Migration enquiry via EthicalJobs.

We will begin shortlisting immediately, so please apply as soon as possible.

Gender Specific Role

We are a women-only team and have an exception under the Equal Opportunity Act to employ only women.

Equal Opportunity Employer

We value the unique backgrounds, experiences and contributions that each person brings to our organisation and encourage and celebrate diversity. First Nations people, those identifying as LGBTQIA+, people of all ages, with disabilities and culturally diverse people are encouraged to apply. We take our values seriously and work hard to create an environment where you feel welcomed. Women’s Legal reflects diversity of experience, identity, perspective, and background to create a healthy & inclusive working culture.
447735.summary: Be a part of a feminist community organisation supporting Victorian women at Women's Legal Service Victoria, in Melbourne's CBD. Full time or Part time - negotiable and a Hybrid working model.

447687.title: Specialist Behaviour Support Practitioners x2 - Proficient / Psychologist
447687.description:
• Location: North (Broadmeadows) Regions
  • Vacancy Type: Permanent - Full time / Part Time- Two (2) vacancies
  • Job reference: 494385
  • Salary Range: $80,897.66 – $98,550.20 (depends on experience)

Are you passionate about making a positive impact on the lives of individuals with disabilities?

As a Specialist Behaviour Support (SBS) Practitioner / Psychologist, you will play a pivotal role in enhancing the quality of life for individuals with disabilities. Utilising the Positive Behaviour Support (PBS) approach, which focuses on human rights and evidence-based methods, you'll work collaboratively to reduce the frequency and severity of behaviours of concern while empowering individuals to thrive.

Key Responsibilities

  • Manage Clinical Case Load: You will manage a clinical case load within your scope of practice while meeting clinical Key Performance Indicators.
  • Apply PBS Concepts: Apply your expertise in disability and Positive Behaviour Support concepts.
  • Develop Comprehensive Support Plans: Develop Interim Behaviour Support Plans and conduct Functional Behaviour Assessments to create evidence-informed, proactive Comprehensive Behaviour Support Plans that improve quality of life.
  • Implement and Monitor Plans: Implement Behaviour Support Plans, adapting strategies to different environments and training support systems. Continuously monitor and evaluate their effectiveness against measurable outcomes.
  • Professional Development: Participate in professional development to expand your skills and knowledge, ensuring consistent, safe, and high-quality behaviour support services.
  • Supervision: Engage in supervision provided by Yooralla and/or external providers, and provide supervision to Core-level NDIS registered Behaviour Support Practitioners.

Mandatory Requirements

A Proficient Practitioner must demonstrate attainment of completed self-assessment and endorsed according to the National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS) PBS Capability Framework as either all domains “capability met” or as “developing” in their competencies and knowledge at Proficient Level. To be successful in this role you’ll share Yooralla’s values and have:

  • Current National Police Record Check
  • International Police Check (if required)
  • Working with Children Check
  • NDIS Worker Screening Check
  • Current driver's license valid in Australia
  • Tertiary qualification in relevant discipline (e.g., psychology, social work, occupational therapy, applied behaviour analysis, disability, health)
  • Registration (or eligibility for registration) as a Proficient Practitioner under the NDIS Positive Behaviour Support Capability Framework
  • Previous experience as a Core/Proficient Practitioner under the NDIS Positive Behaviour Support (PBS) Capability Framework
  • Up-to-date Immunisation History
  • Access to your vehicle with employment-related travel reimbursement provided (Travel is an expectation of the position)

Professional Experience (Desirable)

  • Previous experience working in a disability-related field (e.g., disability support work, support coordination, disability advocacy)
  • Lived experience of disability

If you are a Registered Psychologist, you must have:

  • Post-graduate tertiary qualification in psychology
  • Full registration as a psychologist with Australian Health Practitioner Regulation Agency (AHPRA).

Sound like you? Hit Apply!

Click the "Apply Now" button. To find out more about this role or working with Yooralla, please contact Nada Grbec on 0499 472 346 or nada.grbec@yooralla.com.au using the subject line: Specialist Behaviour Support Practitioner - Proficient / Psychologist enquiry via EthicalJobs.

Why Yooralla?

At Yooralla, you’ll work at Victoria’s most established and recognised for purpose disability service provider with more than 100 years of experience offering high quality support services to people with disability. We work in partnership with adults and children, their families and carers to enable them to live the lives they choose. Find out more about what we do.

We believe in diversity, inclusion and equality and are committed to ensuring that our workplaces are a reflection of the Victorian community. We recognise the benefits that diversity and inclusion brings, and in turn encourage talented people from all backgrounds, abilities and identities to apply to our vacancies. We strongly encourage people with disability, LGBTQIA+ and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islands People to apply.

Find out more about our workplace culture.
447687.summary: If you are registered (or eligible to register) Psychologist, passionate, positive relationship builder,ready to provide excellent support for people with disability to reach their goals – Apply Now!

447239.title: Specialist Behaviour Support Practitioners x2 - Advanced / Psychologist
447239.description:
• Location: North (Broadmeadows) Regions
  • Vacancy Type: Permanent - Full time / Part Time - Two (2) vacancies
  • Job reference: 494386
  • Salary Range: $98,919.59 – $125,490.51 (depends on experience)

Are you an experienced and compassionate psychologist ready to make a profound impact on the lives of individuals with disabilities?

As a Specialist Behavioural Support Practitioner – Advanced / Registered Psychologist, you will be a pivotal part of our team, utilising the Positive Behaviour Support (PBS) approach to empower individuals with disabilities to improve their quality of life and reduce the frequency and severity of behaviours of concern. This role combines advanced psychological expertise with a deep commitment to human rights and evidence-based practices.

Key Responsibilities

  • Clinical Case Management: Manage a complex clinical case load within your scope of practice while meeting clinical Key Performance Indicators.
  • Service Delivery: Deliver a minimum of 25 service hours per week (full-time equivalent), inclusive of providing supervision to team members.
  • Advanced Psychological Expertise: Conduct psychological assessments (e.g., risk assessment, cognitive assessment, ADHD/ASD assessment, mental health assessment, personality assessment) and deliver evidence-based psychological counselling as part of the Yooralla Psychology Clinic.
  • Behavioural Support: Apply PBS concepts and models of practice complementary to PBS, shaping strategic thinking in Positive Behaviour Support.
  • Plan Development and Implementation: Develop Interim Behaviour Support Plans and Comprehensive Behaviour Support Plans based on Functional Behaviour Assessments to improve individuals' quality of life.
  • Supervision and Leadership: Provide direct supervision to NDIS Positive Behaviour Support Practitioners at all other levels and shape practice leadership across settings and interactions with stakeholders.
  • Continuous Improvement: Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of Behaviour Support Plans, including the reduction of restrictive practices, and recommend regulated restrictive practices as required.
  • Professional Development: Participate in ongoing professional development to enhance your skills and knowledge in delivering consistent, safe, and high-quality psychological and behaviour support services.

Mandatory Requirements

To be successful in this role you’ll share Yooralla’s values and have:

  • Current National Police Record Check
  • International Police Check (if required)
  • Working with Children Check
  • NDIS Worker Screening Check
  • Current driver's license valid in Australia
  • Post-graduate tertiary qualification in Psychology
  • Full registration as a psychologist with the Australian Health Practitioner Regulation Agency (AHPRA)
  • Registration as an Advanced Practitioner under the NDIS Positive Behaviour Support Capability Framework
  • Previous experience working as a Proficient/Advanced Practitioner under the NDIS Positive Behaviour Support (PBS) Capability Framework
  • Up-to-date Immunisation History
  • Access to your vehicle with employment-related travel reimbursement provided (Travel is an expectation of the position)

Professional Experience (Desirable)

  • Previous experience working in a disability-related field (e.g., disability support work, support coordination, disability advocacy)
  • Lived experience of disability

About You

You are a compassionate and dedicated professional with a genuine interest in supporting individuals with disabilities. Your exceptional interpersonal skills, both in verbal and written communication, enable you to lead, motivate, and engage people while fostering their growth. You empower individuals to exercise choice and control, recognising the vital role of family, friends, carers, and community supports. You view individuals with disabilities as equal partners in the therapeutic relationship, embodying compassion, empathy, and respect in all interactions.

Sound like you? Hit Apply!

Click the "Apply Now" button. To find out more about this role or working with Yooralla, please contact Nada Grbec on 0499 472 346 or nada.grbec@yooralla.com.au using the subject line: Specialist Behaviour Support Practitioners x2 - Advanced / Psychologist enquiry via EthicalJobs.

Why Yooralla?

At Yooralla, you’ll work at Victoria’s most established and recognised for purpose disability service provider with more than 100 years of experience offering high quality support services to people with disability. We work in partnership with adults and children, their families and carers to enable them to live the lives they choose. Find out more about what we do.

We believe in diversity, inclusion and equality and are committed to ensuring that our workplaces are a reflection of the Victorian community. We recognise the benefits that diversity and inclusion brings, and in turn encourage talented people from all backgrounds, abilities and identities to apply to our vacancies. We strongly encourage people with disability, LGBTQIA+ and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islands People to apply.

Find out more about our workplace culture.
447239.summary: If you are a Registered Psychologist, passionate, positive relationship builder, ready to provide excellent support for people with disability to reach their goals – Apply Now!

447660.title: Service Designer
447660.description:
About them:

For decades, this not-for-profit (NFP) has provided crucial support to thousands of Australians facing their darkest moments. Through their digital products, this NFP has created an online self-help channel, aiming to help people, no matter where they’re at in their journey.

About the role:

This NFP is currently embarking on a major transformation of their core technology, platforms and workforce capability. This program of work is looking closely at the customer journey and improving the end-to-end experience across all their products and services.

Working in the Digital Product and Experience team you’ll use Human Centred Design approach to research, ideate, validate, realise and iterate products, services and experiences to better meet customer needs.

On a typical day you will:

  • Document the current customer journey, identify pain points and opportunities for enhancement.
  • Pilot, measure and learn. Look at testing new services that provide real world value to customers.
  • Align technology, business and operations around user needs at any point in the journey for all the different customer touch points.
  • Organise run and find insights from user-testing sessions and other research methodologies to inform service design decision.
  • Translate learnings into frameworks that can inform service delivery guidelines and documentation.

You’ll also work with internal teams and capabilities to design the people, process, and technology foundations that enable these experiences.

About you:

As a Service Designer focused on the customer experience, you’ll play a pivotal role in refining and redefining the customer journey across various channels and touch-points. Your primary focus will be to create a harmonised, intuitive, and efficient experience for every individual reaching out for help, tailoring each interaction to their unique needs.

You’ll also have an action bias and be able to steer diverse stakeholders to implement a solution that helps the end user.

Requirements:

  • A proven background in designing and improving end-to end experiences.
  • Strong collaboration skills and an ability to align diverse stakeholders with the customer needs.
  • An action bias – a background implementing service design prototypes rapidly iterating based on feedback.
  • Excellent skills with service design tooling and a strong background leveraging human centred design principles.
  • A strong understanding of technical environments and ideally a background working within mental health or call centre environments.

This is an excellent opportunity to lead and champion all the service design touch-points in a high profile not-for-profit. For further information contact Reece at reece@arney.com.au using the subject line: Service Designer enquiry via EthicalJobs.
447660.summary: This NFP is currently embarking on a major transformation of their core technology, platforms and workforce capability.  They're reviewing the customer journey to improve their products and services.
447660.application: Please submit your application via the form below.

447609.title: Administration & Centre Support
447609.description:
Picabeen Community Association Inc. (Picabeen) is seeking an experienced Administration and Centre Support Officer to join our team. This is a rewarding role for someone who enjoys creating a welcoming environment, building community connections and supporting service delivery by providing professional administration and centre service and support.

LOCATION

  • Picabeen Community Centre, 22 Hoben Street, Mitchelton, Brisbane.

AWARD CLASSIFICATION

  • Social, Community, Home Care and Disability Services Industry Award 2010, Social and Community Services Employees
  • SACHADS Level 3 or 4 (Depending on level of experience and qualifications)
  • Part time position (subject to continued funding) (Pro-rata Applies)

HOURS OF DUTY

  • 24 or 25 hours per week
  • Hours are required during centre opening hours (between 9am to 4pm, Monday-Friday)
  • 6 or 6.25 hours per day/4 days per week
  • Days of Mon/Tues/Thursday/Friday (some flexibility with days of week/negotiable)
  • Initial contract until December 2024 (subject to 3 monthly review and with the possibility of extension)
  • Part time position (subject to continued funding)
  • January 2024 start date

REPORTING RELATIONSHIPS

  • Reports directly to the Centre Manager

ORGANISATIONAL ENVIRONMENT

Picabeen Community Association Inc is a Not For Profit (NFP) organisation and registered charity delivering the following programs:

  • Information and Referral Services
  • Support Services
  • Youth Services Program
  • Community Engagement and Social Inclusion Programs

Picabeen Community Centre is funded in the main by the Department of Treaty, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Partnerships, Communities and the Arts through the Neighbourhood Centre Funding Program and our Picabeen Youth Service is funded through the Department Children, Youth justice and Multicultural Affairs.

Our building is leased through the Brisbane City Council and located in Mitchelton.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES OF POSITION

  • Provide administrative support in the day-to-day operations of Picabeen Community Centre including interfacing with members of the public
  • Use your people skills to support vulnerable members of the community to: Identify and assess initial needs. provide support and advocacy. provide information and referral to appropriate service provider
  • Work closely with other team members (staff/volunteers/students) to support them in their roles including, but not limited to, trouble-shooting IT issues.
  • Work effectively as a member of a team in a small team environment
  • Work from client-centered, strength-based frameworks, and demonstrate a commitment to the principles of social justice
  • Provide confidential administrative support including the production of high-quality documents, records and diary management
  • Provide office administrative duties including the development and implementation of effective administrative and information management systems, managing incoming telephone calls, correspondence, data systems, stationery and office purchases, processing invoices for payment.
  • Participate in staff and administration meetings, including the development of agendas, taking of minutes and meeting preparation as required
  • Contribute to the ongoing development of organisational policies and procedures
  • Use community development principles and practices to develop a range of Community Projects, Community Events and Community Resources
  • Other duties as delegated by the Centre Manager.

KEY SELECTION CRITERIA

Essential:

  • Relevant qualifications and/or significant experience in admin roles and experience in the Community Services Sector, Community Development or Human Services
  • A demonstrated understanding and commitment to the practice and principles of community development and social justice
  • Demonstrated high level competency with computer skills including Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel, Teams and Outlook) and social media
  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience of administrative practices, procedures, and processes
  • Ability to develop and/or maintain accurate and effective and well-organised administrative systems
  • High level written and interpersonal communication skills
  • Demonstrated level of understanding and compassion for the needs of vulnerable community members who experience challenges
  • Demonstrated understanding, experience and ability to engage and relate to people from a diverse range of backgrounds, i.e. social, cultural, experiences, etc.
  • Experience providing support with delivery of community projects or other projects, events, etc. Ability to work autonomously and work collaboratively as part of a team
  • Takes initiative and is proactive towards problem solving

Desirable:

  • Experience of working within Community based organisation
  • Experience and knowledge of strength-based support systems
  • Demonstrated ability to plan and set priorities accompanied by an ability to navigate several tasks concurrently with minimal supervision
  • Use of own car (must be roadworthy), current Open QLD Driver’s License with comprehensive insurance (mileage reimbursement paid at ATO rate) Note: Picabeen does not have any company vehicles.

OTHER REQUIREMENTS

  • It is a mandatory requirement to have a current Working with Children Check (Blue Card)
  • Senior First Aid Certificate (or ability to obtain)

Any enquiries, please contact info@picabeen.org.au or jwarren@picabeen.org.au using the subject line: Administration & Centre Support enquiry via EthicalJobs.

A position description is attached.
447609.summary: Picabeen Community Centre is seeking an experienced Admin & Centre Support officer to join our small Neighbourhood Centre team in Mitchelton. Welcoming & flexible work environment-25 hours/4-day week.

If you meet the essential key selection criteria, please follow the below steps:

  • Read the Position Description and Duty Statement (attached)
  • Provide a detailed resume
  • Provide a covering letter outlining what you can bring to the role (no more than 2 pages)
  • Provide details of two (2) referees who have supervised your work
  • Submit your application via the form below

447578.title: Residential Manager - Dorothy Boyt House
447578.description:
• Are you a highly organised person that loves all people?
  • Do you have a real “can-do attitude”?
  • Are you a respected manager with aged care experience?
  • Are you looking for a great service to manage?
  • Malabar location
  • Well-established facility
  • Join an experienced multidisciplinary team

Dorothy Boyt House originally opened in 1973 but has since been completely rebuilt and is now home to a friendly community of 62 residents. The outdoor spaces on the top level have views overlooking the beach and surrounding greenery.

About the role:

Due to internal movement, we are seeking a committed and experienced clinical professional to join our hard-working team as a Residential Care Manager within our friendly aged care facility.

In this role, you will effectively lead and manage staff, resources, financials as well as work closely with stakeholders to deliver the best standards of clinical care in a caring Christian environment.

Your drive to achieving outstanding results will be pivotal in managing the day-to-day operations as you build strong relations with residents, family and staff.

Key responsibilities (not limited to):

  • Undertake the overall responsibility of the operations of the home to deliver high quality services to residents and their families
  • Creating a positive work culture for our staff through effective leadership and HR management
  • Management of finances and budgets
  • Ensure Quality planning, implementation and evaluation
  • Provide leadership and operational support
  • Promoting an interactive WH&S system to ensure optimum health and wellbeing of staff

Skills, knowledge and experience needed:

  • A high level of business acumen including strong financial management experience
  • A passion for Aged Care
  • Previous management experience of diverse teams Leadership skills and the ability to delegate
  • Aged Care experience highly desirable
  • Knowledge of ACFI, the Aged Care Act, WHS, accreditation and continuous improvement
  • Experience in Residential Care management
  • A commitment to the Christian Values of Anglicare
  • Current AHPRA registration ( desirable but not essential): Clinical background as an Registered Nurse or related discipline is highly desirable.

You must be able to work effectively both independently and as part of a cohesive team striving to achieve a very high standard of resident satisfaction, working with a team of professionals to enhance the lives of older people.

Jesus Christ honoured, lives enriched & communities strengthened.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander candidates are encouraged to apply.

Applicants are encouraged to apply as soon as possible as applications may be reviewed prior to the closing date; and as such the closing date is subject to change without notice.

Anglicare is committed to ensuring the safety and wellbeing of children and young people and has zero tolerance of child abuse.
447578.summary: We are seeking a committed and experienced clinical professional to join our hard-working team as a Residential Care Manager within our friendly aged care facility.

447567.title: Care Manager - Brian King Gardens
447567.description:
• Enjoy above award hourly rates
  • Not for profit salary packaging benefits– earn up to $15900 tax free
  • Work with a caring, Christian employer where you can do your best work

About the Role:

Brian King Gardens, Anglicare's residential facility and home to 236 residents is based at Castle Hill. This nurturing home offers a friendly environment for staff and residents.

The Brian King Gardens team is seeking a motivated Care Manager who is passionate about quality clinical care to join an exceptional team of care professionals on a permanent fulltime basis. Working closely with the Residential Manager, you will ensure that our residents’ clinical and health outcomes are met and understood by overseeing the activities of our clinical team. You will also ensure the clinical excellence in the home, that all Anglicare policies, procedures and practises are followed and that clinical standards are continually improved. Moreover, you will ensure that a person-centred approach is taken to resident care.

To be successful in this role, you will have solid clinical experience, proven leadership capabilities and a true passion for enhancing the life and wellbeing of residents. The ideal candidate will be a People Manager, strong problem solver, team orientated and highly organised.

In return, you will be supported by an experienced clinical team of subject matter experts including Dementia, Palliative Care and ACFI.

Key Responsibilities (not limited to):

  • You will be responsible for establishing comprehensive communication between the multidisciplinary team within the facility and other relevant staff;
  • You will ensure ACFI is optimised and suitable residents are admitted appropriately to our facility;
  • You will work closely with the residents’ families, ensuring that they are fully informed about clinical issues relating to their relative;
  • You will also have the opportunity to contribute to the effective functioning of the team through mentoring staff and sharing clinical knowledge and skills.

Skills, knowledge, attributes and experience required:

  • Current nursing registration with AHPRA
  • Minimum 3 years experience as Care Manager or senior Registered Nurse within Aged care
  • A ‘hands on’ approach to ensuring quality clinical care
  • The ability to supervise, delegate and work as part of a team
  • A commitment to the Christian values of Anglicare
  • Strong clinical knowledge including working knowledge of ACFI
  • Demonstrated knowledge of aged care accreditation standards
  • Post graduate study in relevant discipline/s (geriatrics, dementia, palliative care) highly desirable

We are a forward-thinking organisation who focus on continuous improvement, we encourage innovation and have a great team who put our residents first. If this role sounds like you, we look forward to receiving your application.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander candidates are encouraged to apply.

About us:

For over 160 years Anglicare has been serving people in need- providing care to older people and services to the vulnerable. We began because of people like you, people who saw a need in the community and who were compelled to make a difference. People motivated by Christian love and a passion to serve.

For more information please visit: www.anglicare.org.au

Anglicare - Jesus Christ honoured, lives enriched and communities strengthened.

Anglicare is committed to ensuring the safety and wellbeing of children and young people and has zero tolerance of child abuse.
447567.summary: The Brian King Gardens team is seeking a motivated Care Manager who is passionate about quality clinical care to join an exceptional team of care professionals on a permanent fulltime basis.

447542.title: Senior Manager - Supported Employment - Ability Works
447542.description:
• Empower people with disabilities to achieve their full potential
  • Lead a dynamic team developing innovative and person centred strategies
  • Full-time - with an award-winning social enterprise in Kew Vic

About Us

We are a forward-thinking organisation committed to promoting inclusion, diversity, and equal opportunities for people with disabilities. We create great quality products and services for our business customers. We do this so our employees can get a sense of purpose, belonging and pride that only comes from a job well done - and we must be doing something right - among our many long-term customers are some of the most respected names in Australian business.

We believe everyone deserves the same opportunities to work - but people living with a disability and those who experience social disadvantage often experience significant barriers to employment. Our focus is on breaking down those barriers by providing training and employment with expert support tailored to the needs of our Employees, whilst delivering high quality commercial goods and services to our customers.

About the opportunity

Reporting to the COO, you will lead a team (2 direct reports and 8 in total) that is responsible for inducting, training, and supporting employees in the workplace, and communication with family and carers. You will:

  • Lead our employee support team to deliver the very best outcomes for our employees ensuring their wellbeing, skills development, growth, goal achievement and productivity
  • Guide, mentor and develop Employee Support staff and manage escalations of employee support issues
  • Foster and support a culture of accountability and performance through establishing team goals, monitoring performance and providing feedback
  • Oversee Individual Employment Plans (IEP’s) to ensure goal achievement
  • Promote and manage work experience programs
  • Together with the team, ensure compliance with NDIS Practice Standards and Code of Conduct and that employee’s plans and goals under the NDIS are being fulfilled

Key Requirements

  • Experience leading, supporting and mentoring teams
  • Relevant Formal qualifications (e.g. Community Services/Allied Health/Disability) and experience with people with disabilities and/or other barriers to employment
  • A working knowledge of the NDIS
  • Positive and solution focused with empathetic and respectful management of conflict
  • Valuing diversity, and building inclusive environments where people experience belonging
  • Effective interpersonal and relationship building skills – with the ability to interact and collaborate with colleagues at all levels of the organisation
  • Competency in MS Applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, Internet and various other software applications).

Next Steps

Click 'Apply Now' to submit your application.

Specific questions are to be forwarded to Mark Dalton, Independent Recruitment Consultant via mark@recruitmentchap.com using the subject line: Senior Manager - Supported Employment - Ability Works enquiry via EthicalJobs.

A position description is attached.
447542.summary: Empower people with disabilities to achieve their full potential. Lead a dynamic team developing innovative and person centred strategies. Full-time - with an award-winning social enterprise in Kew.
447542.application: Applications including a current resume and a brief application letter outlining your claims to the position are to be addressed to Mark Dalton, Independent Recruitment Consultant via the form below.

447384.title: Counsellor Trauma Specialist
447384.description:
About Us:

Full Stop Australia (FSA) is a not for profit organisation, operating nationally, but based in Sydney's Inner West. Our mission is to put a full stop to sexual, domestic and family violence and to support those who have been impacted by violence and abuse. We also offer best-practice training and professional services to support safe and respectful workplaces, and advocate for changes to laws, policies, and practices to better prevent and respond to sexual, domestic and family violence.

About the Role:

This role will provide a service that is client centred, non-judgemental, feminist, supportive and responsive.

The purpose of this role is to provide telephone and online counselling, advocate for clients, develop interagency clinical care networks and other supports to people affected by violence and their supporters.

About You:

This position of trust demands the highest levels of professionalism, ethical behaviour and an awareness of multiple factors which will influence individual client’s responses to both the trauma and the counselling provided.

You will also have extensive knowledge, skills, and experience in the following areas:

  • Commitment to the provision of excellence in counselling services provision.
  • Ability to incorporate feminist perspectives within counselling frameworks.
  • Detailed understanding other causes and consequences of sexual assault, family and domestic violence.
  • Written advocacy and clinical report writing.
  • Four year bachelor’s degree in psychology, social work or equivalent.
  • Minimum three years (ft equivalent) counselling experience.

In return:

Benefits: We offer above award wages, with additional benefits including salary packaging, paid parental leave, study leave, and access to our award-winning workplace well-being program designed to manage the effects of vicarious trauma. Professional development and training are highly valued within our organisation.

Salary: This position has been classified as Level 5 under the Social, Community, Home, and Disability Services (SCHADS) Award.

Contract: This is a one year contract ( with possible extension) part time position, requiring a minimum of six shifts per fortnight (46.5 hours).

Full Stop Australia offers a hybrid model of working, with the option to work part of your hours from home (where applicable).
FSA holds an exemption under the NSW Anti-Discrimination Act and only employs female workers for clinical positions.

For more Information and how to Apply:

For further information, email jobs@fullstop.org.au using the subject line: Counsellor Trauma Specialist enquiry via EthicalJobs or call 02 8585 0333.

There is no closing date for this position. Applications will be assessed as they come in so please submit your application quickly.

A position description is attached.
447384.summary: Committed to excellence in the provision of counselling services? Want to work for an organisation that makes a real difference to the lives of those affected by sexual, domestic, and family violence?

447330.title: Creation Space Specialist
447330.description:
• Great Opportunity to lead services in our Creation Space
  • Join a close-knit and supportive team at a progressive lower north shore council
  • Full-time permanent opportunity with a Rostered Day Off every 3 weeks
  • Package from $66,642 to $83,733 pa plus super

The Role

Mosman Library is recruiting for an innovative high performer to lead services in our busy Creation Space.

In this role you will be responsible for coordinating the design and delivery of an inspiring range of programmes and events. These include code club, robotics and Minecraft for school children through to VR for teens and 3D and laser cut workshops for adults. We also have fully equipped sound and video studios.

The Creation Space at Mosman Library is fitted out to a high level and has been activated by our dynamic library team. All we need now is the right person to coordinate everything that happens to ensure the Mosman community continues to have amazing creative experiences.

About You

We are looking for an innovative and creative person with leadership experience.

You will have experience designing and delivering programmes and events that incorporate STEAM, creative tech, robotics, design and craft. Ideally you will have led delivery of these services in a library, education setting or innovation lab.

Your skill set will also include experience working with children and adults, as well as the ability to inspire and work collaboratively with teams across an organisation.

We want someone who knows the tech inside out, who is confident and experienced in programme delivery, and who will lead services in the Creation Space forward.

In addition to this you will also hold a valid Working with Children Check and a valid Covid-19 vaccination certificate and

Tertiary qualification in library studies, education or STEAM technologies.

How to Apply

If you enjoy diverse work where no day is the same, apply now! 

All enquiries regarding this position will remain private and confidential and can be directed to Christopher Pigott on 9978 4017.

Interested, like to know more? Please go to the Careers at Council page of our website at https://mosman.nsw.gov.au/council/employment

Mosman Council is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion.

Mosman Council is committed to creating safer communities for children and young people.

A position description is attached.
447330.summary: Mosman Council are excited to recruit for a motivated Creation Space Specialist to join their close-knit team.

447335.title: Support Worker - Plus
447335.description:
Do you want to be a part of a ground-breaking service for adults with complex behaviours?

Are you values driven and compassionate with a person centred approach to your work?

Are you looking for a challenge in a work environment where each day is different, learning new skills is supported and opportunities to develop your career are offered?

At PLUS, we have always believed that with the right support, everyone can participate in society and make their contribution. Our vision is to become Australia’s leading service for adults with complex behaviours and we need an unbeatable workforce to achieve this.

WHY YOU’LL LIKE US:

  • We think we have an unbeatable workforce, and so we want to recognise and support our staff. A role with Plus means you’ll have Support from a Program Manager, Assistant Manager and our experienced Behaviour Support team to learn and upskill in a way which suits you.
  • Ongoing informal and formal professional development opportunities and a strong training and learning culture.
  • Career progression opportunities, into clinical and/or management positions and other internal broadening role.
  • Salary Packaging Options - increase your take home pay by salary packaging up to $15,000 of your pay
  • Casual and permanent part-time positions available
  • An opportunity to be part of a dynamic team with a fantastic workplace culture
  • For-purpose work
  • Shorter work days from 8.45am to 3.30pm

THE ROLE:

The Support Worker is a critical role, everything that we set out to achieve is dependent on providing superior support in the delivery of our programs and services on a day-to-day basis. In this support role, you will hone your skills whilst supporting individuals one-on-one (in a centre-based and community access program) to build relationships and assist people with complex needs to reach their goals.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:

  • Delivering person-centred support to participants directly and indirectly under their care, and ensuring it is provided in the way the participant wants it.
  • Providing all aspects of support and assistance with daily tasks while following best-practice principles.
  • Building relationships with participants that reflects Plus' values and Disability Service Standards - building a culture of ‘yes!’
  • Providing feedback to families and caretakers about support provided and progress towards goals
  • Using your creativity to think outside of the square about how to deliver support. Imagining ‘what if’ in every scenario.
  • Completing relevant reporting in a timely fashion

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:

  • A professional, positive and passionate approach to providing the highest level of support
  • Be energetic, ambitious and seeking to learn and grow in the role
  • Possess or be willing to obtain an NDIS Worker Screening Check and a Working with Children Check
  • Possess or be willing to obtain Provide First Aid & CPR
  • Hold a NSW Drivers Licence (desirable)
  • Fully Covid Vaccinated, including Booster

PLUS is not ‘your average’ day program! So, if you are not ‘your average’ employee, we want to hear from you!

To be considered for this position please attach a cover letter outlining your suitability to the position, along with your current resume.

Find out more: plusdisability.com.au.
447335.summary: Do you want to be a part of a ground-breaking service for adults with complex behaviours?

447285.title: NDIS Support Coordinator - Multiple Locations
447285.description:
LOCATIONS

Greater Sydney – Central Coast – Hunter – Lake Macquarie NSW

ABOUT US

Katana Ink’ Services is passionate in making a difference in people’s life. We are driven to help individuals, families and the community in times of need. Katana Ink’ Services is a contemporary and agile organisation that prides itself in placing the person we serve at the forefront of our thinking, our actions and our service delivery.

Equally important is the team of people who deliver crucial disability services and supports within our communities.

Simply ‘we do things differently' by creating an opportunity for people that are passionate, driven and seek to embrace a different style of operational service delivery within the community and disability sector.

THE PURPOSE OF THE ROLE

To strengthen and build life skills to support people to understand, implement and use their plan that is personalised and designed to assist a person to achieve their goals and aspirations to live the life they want to live.

As a Support Coordinator, you will work to ensure a mix of supports and services are effective to increase people’s capacity to maintain relationships and to assist people to live more independently within their communities, goals and aspirations to live the life you want to live.

ESSENTIAL, THE SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WIL HAVE:

  • Minimum Cert 1V Disability / Community Services AND / OR relevant tertiary qualifications or A graduate qualifications in Social Welfare, Social Work combined with relevant experience.
  • Minimum 1 yr experience as a NDIS LAC/Planner or Support Coordinator
  • Excellent knowledge of the NDIS Practice standards and current best practice industry standards.
  • Strong customer service focus with demonstrated ability to develop and maintain relationships with people and / or their families and support network and service providers.
  • Sound time management skills and demonstrated ability to work with minimal supervision.
  • Demonstrated ability to make complex judgements, prioritise tasks and take initiative.
  • Possess the right to work in Australia.
  • Demonstrated understanding of a strengths-based practice and a person centred approach in your work.
  • Strong written communication skills with the ability to write high quality reports.
  • Approved and current NDIS Worker Screening Check.
  • Working with Children’s Check.
  • COVID – 19 vaccination certificate.

DESIRABLE

  • Australian Business Number (ABN).
  • Certificate of currency for both Public Liability and Professional Indemnity and or willingness to obtain.

BENEFITS

  • Achieve work-life balance and real autonomy in your role. Genuine flexibility to work around your other commitments.
  • Have the benefit of being part of a great team as an independent contractor and be rewarded professionally with ‘great pay’ for your skills and expertise.

join the team

Please click "Apply Now" to submit your application.
447285.summary: Creating an opportunity for people that are passionate, driven and seek to embrace a different style of operational service delivery as an Independent Contractor in community and disability sector.

447193.title: CEO - AusBiotech Ltd - Canberra / Sydney / Melbourne
447193.description:
• AS877

AusBiotech is Australia’s national body for the biotechnology and life sciences sector and advocates for members to enhance global investment and economic growth.

AusBiotech seeks a committed and influential individual who can implement a bold strategy to build member engagement, champion domestic and international advocacy and policy, strengthen relevance and pursue opportunities to ensure the sustainability and growth of the sector.

Commitment and experience within the medical technology, biotechnology and pharmaceutical sector is paramount. An ability to build relationships and leverage networks to advance the needs of diverse members must be backed by strong business acumen.

To apply: Please view the Position Profile below and click on "Apply Now", attaching a tailored CV (Word version) or call Jeremy Wurm on 0419 529 525 or Lesley Lightfoot on 0429 381 277, to enquire.

Overview:

AusBiotech is seeking a strong influential leader and advocate for the Australian life science sector. The CEO will represent the diverse needs of members with key stakeholders to ensure the landscape supports ongoing opportunities for investment and economic growth. AusBiotech is a national leading peak body seeking to build on its already established national and international convening power by strengthening policy influence, collaborating with peer bodies across states and sectors and elevating the Australian life sciences sector on the international stage.

Primary Purpose of the Position :

The CEO is responsible for developing and executing a ‘strategy for the future’ within the framework established by the Board, taking AusBiotech and the Australian life sciences sector to the next level of domestic and global success.

Reporting to the Board through the Chair, this role will be responsible for driving a strategic agenda to build member engagement, champion advocacy and policy, strengthen relevance through strategic relationships and actions, identify growth opportunities and ensure the sustainability and vibrancy of the sector and the organisation.

Based around two key pillars, the CEO will 1) cement AusBiotech as the leading national body for the life sciences sector, driving and influencing effective policy change to strengthen and sustain the sector, and creating a strong united voice to Government by leading collaboration with peer bodies across states and sectors; and 2) elevate the Australian life sciences sector on the international stage, providing a conduit to promote and attract international interest and investment to the sector.

The CEO will be responsible for building on the established position of the organisation (both nationally and internationally), managing and optimising relationships with a complex array of stakeholders across the Australian medical technology, biotechnology and pharmaceutical industries and governments; and achieving operational, financial and other goals of the business as set by the Board.

Key Accountabilities:

  1. Understand the needs of a diverse membership and prioritise advocacy goals.
  2. Shape and influence the national policy and business environment.
  3. Build strong and mutually beneficial relationships with partners to scale advocacy.
  4. Shape and strengthen member connections, networks and opportunities.
  5. Position Australia and the sector internationally for global recognition and sector growth.
  6. Provide thought leadership that influences sector agendas and makes a difference.
  7. Develop a strong and capable high performing team reinforced by a positive safe culture.
  8. Manage the budget with a focus on growth and sustainability.
  9. Pursue growth opportunities and manage risk to expand influence and relevance.
  10. Ensure appropriate ethical and legally compliant behaviours.

Experience and Knowledge Desired:

  1. Authentic leadership with credible sector-relevant networks and ability to influence.
  2. Excellent understanding of the sector and domestic and international policy environment.
  3. Strategic thinking and evidence of execution to gain traction and momentum, with proven ability to deliver change.
  4. Experience managing diverse stakeholders, needs and expectations. Experience with a membership body highly regarded.
  5. Ability to build and maintain strategic and enduring relationships with key stakeholders, including with governments and other peak bodies.
  6. Team builder with a commitment to culture, health and safety excellence.
  7. Ability to execute a strategic plan, explore growth opportunities and manage risk to ensure success.
  8. Proven financial competency and acumen informed by experience.
  9. Comfort with complexity, ability to negotiate effectively with a focus on solutions, relationships and responsiveness.
  10. Exceptional verbal and written communication skills and thought leadership.

Location

National role

AUSBIOTECH DESIRED BEHAVIOURS

  • Influential and respected leader with gravitas
  • Passionate about life sciences
  • Energetic and driven self-starter
  • Innovative and responsive to change and opportunities
  • Focused on achieve strategic outcomes
  • Accountable and transparent
  • Highly collaborative and approachable
  • Change agent that brings others along
447193.summary: AusBiotech is seeking a strong influential leader and advocate for the Australian life science sector.

447208.title: National Industrial Officer
447208.description:
Organisational Context

The Health Services Union (HSU) is one of Australia’s fastest growing unions, with around 100,000 members. Our members are at the forefront of nation-changing initiatives such as the National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS), aged care and broader reforms to the public and mental health systems. The HSU is comprised of eight autonomous branches and the role of HSU National is to facilitate cross-branch coordination, which supports membership growth, and, by extension, the collective power of HSU members. Through this, we ensure that HSU members have a strong and powerful voice in the debates that shape their working lives and their communities.

The Role

We are seeking a highly motivated, experienced and driven individual who can contribute to the union’s industrial advocacy work in the Fair Work Commission and other forums. The position will involve developing and implementing the industrial aspects of our strategic campaigns and building relationships with HSU branches and key external stakeholders (e.g., other unions, peak bodies, advocacy organisations, employers and politicians) to deliver on industrial outcomes for our members.

Working as part of a small team and reporting to the HSU National Secretary, the National Industrial Officer will support our national campaigns, including special cases to vary Modern Awards in the health and social care sectors, prepare cases and inquiry submissions and appear before industrial tribunals, courts, and parliamentary inquiries. The position also provides strategic industrial support and advice to HSU leadership and branches. For more information about the role, please refer to the attached position description.

Selection Criteria

  • Highly developed problem solving and conceptual thinking skills.
  • Demonstrated experience in industry advocacy, case preparation and presentation in the FWC and a sound working knowledge of the Australian industrial relations framework.
  • Experience and knowledge of the current modern award system, objectives, and review processes.
  • Outstanding writing skills, with demonstrated experience in preparing submissions, witness evidence and submissions to tribunals and government enquiries.
  • Excellent verbal communication skills with the ability to quickly establish rapport and build relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
  • High-level desktop, qualitative and quantitative research skills.
  • Ability to work independently with a high degree of initiative.
  • Demonstrated commitment to the values and underlying principles of the union movement, social justice, community development and equality.

Benefits

This is a full-time position. The successful applicant will be employed in accordance with the HSU National Employee Agreement 2021 – 2024 which includes:

  • Competitive salary commensurate with skills and experience.
  • 5 weeks annual leave.
  • Monthly rostered day off.
  • 12.5% superannuation

The position is based in our office in Carlton, Victoria with an option to work from home one day a week.

The successful applicant will be required to travel interstate and perform out-of-hours work on occasion.

Shortlisted candidates will be interviewed, and appointment is conditional upon a successful reference check and a probationary period.

If you have questions about the role, please contact Ms Louise de Plater, National Industrial Officer, at louised@hsu.net.au using the subject line: National Industrial Officer enquiry via EthicalJobs, or on 0429 928 192.

We value a diverse workplace and strongly encourage women, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with cultural and linguistic diversity, LGBTGIA+ individuals, people with disabilities, and mature-age people to apply.
447208.summary: Are you an excellent industrial advocate, with a passion for supporting working people? If so – an exciting opportunity has opened at Health Services Union National for a National Industrial Officer.
447208.application:
To apply, please read the linked job description and submit your CV, alongside a cover letter addressing the principal duties and outlining why you would be most suitable for the role (your cover letter should be no more than 2-pages).

Applications are to be addressed to Mr Lloyd Williams, HSU National Secretary

If you have previous relevant work samples (e.g., a written submission to the FWC or an inquiry or consultation paper) we encourage you to submit these with your application.
